channel.title: Comments on: The Thomas Pynchon indie rock hoax

item.title: By: heyadamo
item.dc:creator: heyadamo
item.description: OK, I'll admit having Lotion's ex-lead singer respond and refute this is more than a little cool. Man, I loved them back in my college days -- I still have most of their discography on my iPod, matter of fact.
item.content:encoded: OK, I’ll admit having Lotion’s ex-lead singer respond and refute this is more than a little cool. Man, I loved them back in my college days — I still have most of their discography on my iPod, matter of fact.

item.title: By: tony z
item.dc:creator: tony z
item.description: THE PYNCHON STORY IS NOT BULLSHIT. Read the article. The only bullshit was the exact story we told the New Yorker, who were foolish enough to print without checking (that we met at Sudsy's in Cincinnati, doing laundry in a Godzilla tshirt.) We really know him. He really hung out with us. He really wrote the liner notes. The End.
item.content:encoded: THE PYNCHON STORY IS NOT BULLSHIT. Read the article. The only bullshit was the exact story we told the New Yorker, who were foolish enough to print without checking (that we met at Sudsy’s in Cincinnati, doing laundry in a Godzilla tshirt.) We really know him. He really hung out with us. He really wrote the liner notes. The End.

item.title: By: heyadamo
item.dc:creator: heyadamo
item.description: Does that mean the Vanity Fair interview Pynchon did with the band is a hoax as well? Another bit of Lotion trivia: they appeared on Buffy The Vampire Slayer.
item.content:encoded: Does that mean the Vanity Fair interview Pynchon did with the band is a hoax as well? Another bit of Lotion trivia: they appeared on Buffy The Vampire Slayer.

item.title: By: K
item.dc:creator: K
item.description:
Lotion sang "head" which was on "modern rock" radio a lot back in the mid '90s.
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cdZ4rj9duqc
Odd story.
item.content:encoded:
Lotion sang “head” which was on “modern rock” radio a lot back in the mid ’90s.
